author: Special Correspondent
text:
More than one fourth of the candidates, who have applied for Village Administrative Officer (VAO) posts, failed to turned up for the written examinations held in various centres of the district on Sunday. Out of 43,612 candidates, only 31,989 candidates wrote the examinations conducted by the Tamil Nadu Public Service Commission in Tiruchi district. The examinations were held in 101 centres.

Collector K.S. Palanisamy visited Jeganmatha Matriculation Higher Secondary School, Arockiamatha Matriculation Higher Secondary School and National College, where the examinations were held in Tiruchi city. Similarly, 15 flying squads, which were formed to check malpractices if any, inspected various centres. The examinations were videographed.

Perambalur

A total of 6,787 candidates appeared in the VAO written examination conducted by the Tamil Nadu Public Service Commission in Perambalur district on Sunday.

Collector K. Nandakumar, who visited a few centres in the town, said that out of 9145 candidates, 2358 did not turn up for the examinations, which were conducted in 11 centres.

Nagapattinam

In Nagapattinam district, the examination was conducted in 68 centres. As many as 21,681 candidates turned up for the examination. S. Palanisamy, Collector, visited the examination held at Jaya Matriculation School. A total of 68 flying squads functioned in the district to carry out surprise check.
title: More absentees in VAO exam
